intro: Crepis pulchra subsp. pulchra, commonly known as the pretty hawk's-beard, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its yellow composite flowers and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It produces small, elongated achenes that are dispersed by wind. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically important species in its native range.
